headline: Founder and CEO at Xendit | Forbes 30 under 30
summary: I'm currently changing the way financial services are provided in South East Asia.  Find me in Silicon Valley, Jakarta or somewhere in between.

experiences.title: Founder and CEO
experiences.description:
We're building payments infrastructure for South East Asia:
- Processing >500m USD annually
- Growing 20% month on month for last 2 years
- Featured in: Techcrunch, Forbes, e27,
- YC S15 company
- Forbes 30 under 30 (Asia, Finance & VC)

Anything that needs doing.  At any time that could be product management, customer acquisition and/or business development. Or just taking the bins out.

experiences.title: Retail Leadership Development
experiences.description:
Marketing: Increased revenues per email by 600% by developing new marketing strategy - built personalized marketing campaigns based on shopping history via SQL

Business development: Designed B2B go-to-market strategy to enter $110b market – included first ever discussions with B2B customers to understand needs vs Amazon’s current value proposition

Partner M&A: Built investment thesis to acquire strategic partners and accelerate market entry

experiences.title: Team Leader
experiences.description:
- Led a group of 23 university students to assist in housing development in a disadvantaged community
- Facilitated team meetings and discussion regarding important decisions
- Generated $30,000 in sponsorship and controlled a $100,000 budget
- Attracted the largest team participation in the university program's history

experiences.title: Senior Associate
experiences.description:
Execution acceleration: Implemented project accelerators to reduce call volumes in major Australian telecom provider.  Initiative that had been in progress for two years was executed within 4 weeks of our engagement.  Project management methodology was so successful that it is being rolled out across entire organization.   

Sourcing strategy: Designed and optimized IT sourcing bundles for major healthcare service provider.  Helped client understand true cost of IT and develop better go to market approaches to identify ~10% savings across IT infrastructure spend.

Other positions: Associate Cohort Chair, BCG Charity Chair, High School Mentor, Consulting Skills Training

experiences.title: Associate
experiences.description:
Innovative leadership: Developed integrated remote operations center to fundamentally change how 13,000 people execute operations for global mining conglomerate.  Project won multiple internal awards for impact and innovation

Financial optimization: Identified $100m of savings in large Australian government organization

Organization strategy: Redesigned marketing organization for major Australian media company

accomplishment_publications.name: The impact of IT investment announcements about Y2K compliance on the firm's market value
accomplishment_publications.description: Do IT investments add value to firms? Famously, Carr (2003) argued “No”. Increasingly, the evidence is a resounding “Yes” (Dehning et al. 2003). However, under what conditions do these investments make an impact? This underpins the research aim of this paper to improve the understanding of how IT investment announcements affect the value of firms. To achieve this aim, this study will answer this research question “How do IT investment announcements regarding Y2K compliance affect the market value of companies?” The study will examine and extend current knowledge by proposing an enriched research model. It will then use the event study methodology to test this model assuming a semi-strong market hypothesis. Through the observed abnormal returns, causal relationships will be able to be seen between the variables and their respective market reaction. This will provide conclusions on the variables that influence investor interpretation of a signal, and therefore market reaction.

recommendations:
Paije Penley



Working with Moses at Xendit in Jakarta has been one of the most exciting roles of my career.
Xendit is a seriously fast-paced start-up, and Moses has done an amazing job of building a team that emanates his drive, passion, work ethic and sense of fun! Moses knows that his people are core to success and prioritises them through regular on-on-one coaching sessions, challenging everyone to excel & be their best self. 
Moses isn't all hard work though - Table Tennis, Guitar Hero, Birthday pranks, and futsal matches make regular appearances! Never a dull moment, that's for sure! I'd be lucky to find another team as vibrant, enjoyable, ingenious and inspirational.

Tim Wheeler



Moses was an outstanding colleague when we worked together on a menswear startup. I cannot commend him enough for his dedication, work ethic and analytical skills.
